text: We DRIFT over a scene of Saturday afternoon Americana, a Little League baseball game and cookout at the town FIELD a peaceful suburban community-
A DAD in a grease-spattered apron flips steaks, burgers a dogs on the grill with a long-handled fork~
A little YAPPY DOG scoots around BARKING with apoplectic at the end of its leash, secured to gardening stake whack into the ground at the edge of the parking lot-
PARENTS CHEER their children on-

Come on, Joshua, rip the cover off the ball! TIMMY’S FATHER Buckle down, fellas! On your toes out there! Joshua’s mother sits with little REBECCA, no more than tw three years old, standing on the bleacher seats beside he and her bespectacled son BENJAMIN immersed in a Harry Pot book on the other side. Behind her is a VIDEO ENTHUSIAST parent, recording everything with a high-end VIDEO CAMERA
Come on, honey, lay into it! (nudging Benjamin) Benjamin, stop reading, your brother‘’s up-
I’m aware of that, Mother. We PAN to the FIELD just as JOSHUA swings and hits a grou between first and second- JOSHUA‘S MOTHER Run! Run! Run!

The ball continues into RIGHT FIELD, where little TIMMY, e ba GH major league material, lets it roll between his legs, tur and kicks it a few times before finally picking it up and launching an anemic throw toward the infield, to the chor of-
Throw it! Throw the ball! Throw it!
The ball is retrieved by the first baseman, who hurls it the shortstop covering second, but Joshua is already stan happily on top of the bag. The PITCHER is furious, yellin out to Timmy-
All you got to do is pick it up and throw it! You’re such a spaz!
Hey, none of that! We PAN to see the COACH standing in front of the BENCH of team in the field-
I'll handle the coaching, here!
Do we have to have him out there?
Just get back on the mound, Mister. The Pitcher kicks the dirt and returns to the mound, as t Coach turns angrily to Timmy-
Keep your head down on those grounders and throw ahead of the runner! You're out there pickin daisies!
Timmy's father puts his head in his hands, humiliated-  w
He got a double! ‘e
(still reading) A single and an error. PITCHER’S FATHER That kid in right couldn’t catch a cold in flu season.
Come on, Eli, bring him in!
Timmy dejectedly walks back to his position. A large SHAD sweeps over him-
Yappy Dog is yapping, yapping, then senses something abov ® and freezes, looking up. He starts to WHIMPER-
Little Rebecca is looking up into the sky, fascinated-
Good eyes, Eli! Way to look!
(points) Look, Mommy, birdy-
(not looking up) This is your pitch now! Get some aluminum on it!
Birdy, Mommy, birdy-
(still not looking) That's nice, honey.
‘e
The pitch- CLINK! Eli lifts a very high pop-up into- oh n right field!
TIMMY‘'S FATHER Get under it son! You got it Timmy !
Drop it! Drop it! Drop it!
Timmy unsteadily wobbles under the pop-up, everyone on an off the field SHOUTING instructions at him-
The baseball keeps rising, rising- FWOOSH! A huge black PTEROSAUR swoops out of the heights and snatches the ball its razor-toothed bill, then wings away with powerful strokes!
Frozen in amazement, glove still ready for the ball that won't be coming down for him to drop-
The SPECTATORS are stunned speechless, gaping up at the s Little Rebecca giggles-
Big birdy!
The barbecuing Dad stands frozen with a half-done steak suspended on his fork, trying to make sense of what he ju saw-  © ©
What the- FWAP! Another PTEROSAUR swoops down from behind and snatc the steak off his fork!
Hey!
We shoot from behind the bleachers toward the field and t sky above it. A BLACK SHAPE takes form, winging in over t fence in center field-
The Spectators are standing up, concerned-
(pointing) Look! Up in the sky! It's a- a-
(interested now) It’s some sort of pterosaur, Mother.
Joshua's Mother grabs little Rebecca and ducks with all t Spectators as the PTEROSAUR buzzes the bleachers, SQUAWKI with menace! Only the Video Enthusiast and Benjamin remai standing-
There's a whole flock of them, though ‘flock’ might not be the right word- Joshua’s Mother grabs his arm and yanks him down, turns screaming to the field-
Joshua, run! Run!
Tt locks like a WWI cogfight over the infield, a half-doz PTEROSAURS wheeling and swooping, SQUAWKING hellaciously, LITTLE LEAGUERS scrambling in all directions-

Joshua begins to run down the basepath towards third, a PTEROSAUR flapping after him. As he rounds third the beas makes a lunge, narrowly missing the boy with its talons. Joshua sprints toward home plate and his mother in the bleachers beyond, the pterosaur wheeling and pursuing-
Standing with her daughter in arms now, screaming out- JOSHUA’S MOTHER Run, Joshua, run! Slide!

Just as the PTEROSAUR makes another snatch for him Joshua slides under its grasp and across home plate! The pterosa streaks past, busting partially through the nylon mesh of backstop, SQUAWKING and struggling as it becomes entangle
We SWOOP down from above at the no longer yapping Yappy D

The dog WHIMPERS, takes a hard run- THOONK! and pulls the stake clear out of the ground, scampering away with it trailing him till- FWACK! the swooping PTEROSAUR scoops i and swallows it, flapping away with the leash and stake dangling from its bill!
FAMILY MEMBERS running every whichway as they are dive-bo by PTEROSAURS-—
A. PTEROSAUR crouches on a blanket on the ground, wolfing the abandoned picnic food- Barbecue Dad fends one flying menace eff with his long fo then dives under a PICNIC TABLE for refuge-

General panic on the field. The Pitcher has been standing petrified on the mound throughout, too scared to run or e lie down- His Father is starting out to him from the sidelines, muc impeded by swooping, SQUAWKING PTEROSAURS- PITCHER’S FATHER Just stay right there, Alex! I'm coming for you! But a PTEROSAUR does a Stuka-dive over the backstop and F grabs the boy by the shoulders, lifting him away-

The flying beast flaps hard, trying to get some altitude, lugging the Pitcher only a few feet off the ground as it heads straight toward Timmy in right field! Timmy's Father is running out toward him, aluminum BASEBA BAT in hand- TIMMY ‘S FATHER Grab him, Timmy! Grab him!

Timmy pulls his glove off, estimates, then jumps just as PTEROSAUR is starting to lift off, grabbing the Pitcher's legs with both arms! The extra weight pulls the beast dow close enough to the ground that WHAP! WHAP! WHAP! Timmy's father can start whomping it with the bat. The pterosaur lets the Pitcher go, he and Timmy tumbling to the ground, then flaps away CROAKING a DISTRESS CALL- The Pitcher’s father and Timmy’s father help the boys up- TIMMY ‘S FATHER Nice grab, son. Way to use your head.  ‘e The VIDEO ENTHUSIAST steps past them, pointing his camera the sky-
I think they're leaving! We PAN to see what he’s taping- a PHALANX of PTERCSAURS winging away together-

We TRACK through freaked-out Little Leaguers and their freaked-out parents, trying to comfort them, till we reac home plate where Joshua's Mother is on her knees hugging Joshua as little Rebecca and Benjamin stand by-
Oh, Joshua, that was wonderful! You were so brave!
He didn‘t touch third. She gives her bookworm son a withering look-
This is the last baseball game I take you to, young man.
(prightening) Promise?
The thoroughly enmeshed PTEROSAUR caught in the backstop netting SCREAMS in frustration—

We start on a TV NEWS image of the struggling PTEROSAUR, wrapped .in cut-away backstop netting and with a plastic RESTRAINT holding its bill shut, being carefully carried shell-shocked LITTLE LEAGUERS and PARENTS by a pair of bl uniformed SWAT TEAM members-
The attack, the first occurring within U.S. territory, left several people badly shaken but resulted in no serious injuries.
e
We switch to hand-held HOME VIDEO FOOTAGE shot by the Enthusiast at the game- swooping pterosaurs, screaming humans -

Similar incidents have plagued communities in Central America and Mexico in recent months, leading to the formation of a United Nations task force to exterminate the intrusive pterosaurs. We switch to more professional footage of a pair of littl COMPSOGNATHUS floating on a natural raft of coconut shell and other debris on the OCEAN-
These and a few other formerly extinct species have migrated to the mainland- TV IMAGE - an AERIAL SHOT of ISLA NUBLAR-

-from Isla Nublar, site of the notorious Jurassic Park disaster- TV IMAGE - a dusty street in a CENTRAL AMERICAN TOWN. A FLOCK of scrawny CHICKENS run underfoot in a panic, PEDESTRIANS jump onto cars as a small band of COMPSOGNATH dart around after the chickens. A big hen goes down, FEATHERS flying as the compys dive onto it-
~causing untold damage to crops and livestock. Wilhelm Speiler- A business-suited corporate flak-catcher, SPEILER, appear screen standing before a large CORPORATE LOGO-
-spokesman for Grendel Corporation, the Swiss firm now responsible for the island, had this to say-
(slight Swiss accent) Our eradication of the genetically engineered creatures at the former Jurassic Park is nearly complete. We believe that these current depredations-
NICK HARRIS, a currently unemployed scldier of fortune, watches the TV sceptically as he stands at the counter of
-can be attributed to animals that escaped the island before we at Grendel took possession of it. Harris pushes aside his empty whiskey glass and steps awa
Right, buddy-
We can only regret that we were not given the opportunity to respond to this situation earlier.

Harris squints as the sun hits him. He has a day-old stub on his face and the air of a man who's unhappily killing time. We TRACK with him as he moves down the BOARDWALK pa various BEACH TYPES. A SHADOW drifts over him. He looks u
Swooping low overhead are two, no, three-- PELICANS. Similar outline but without the size and the teeth-
Nick?
JEB OVERTON, wearing a quasi-military UNIFORM, approaches Nick with a halting gait-
It’s you, right? Nick looks him over, smiles slightly-
Captain Overton.  ll.
(embarrassed) I look more like Captain Crunch in this outfit. I haven’t seen you since-- He doesn’t finish the sentence. The place they last saw e other is not one either wishes to reminisce about-
Yeah.
Have you heard from any of the guys?
Haven’t been in the loop for a while.
Wilkens drove his car off a cliff. DeStefano-- well, peacetime is rough for a lot of people.
How bout you?
Oh, I’m the bionic security guard. He hitches up his pants slightly to reveal his ankles- CHROMIUM prosthetics. Both legs are artificial below the knees-
State of the art. I’m in charge of the lock-up over at the aviary- He indicates the large HUMMINGBIRD PATCH on the breast po of his uniform-
-this, like, giant zoo for birds-
I always said you were for the birds.
(grins) Listen, are you still- consulting?  e 12.
(grim) Haven't had a contract in three years.
But if there was one, good money, a little travel, a little adventure-
You’ve been looking for me.
More or less. Harris looks out over the beach. Lots of people having fu
It’s not exactly a stepping-stone to bigger and better things, what we do, is it? He sighs, resigned-
Who's it for?
Well- he’s kind of strange-
An EMU faces us in threat posture, the big, flightless bi making a deep THUMPING noise as it vibrates its massive c
They can get rather territorial in captivity.

Nick and JOHN HAMMOND stroll down a pathway through a sec of high grass in the AVIARY. High above them is a domed CEILING of net, all around are outcroppings of foliage an busy BIRDS. A sturdy NURSE follows them several yards beh
Of course it doesn’t put me in the best of moods, either.
You’re not in captivity.  é ©@ Hemmond shoots a quick lock back to the nurse-
You just can’t see the chains. My late heir managed to get me declared incompetent, my minders are bribed to spy upon me for my enemies-
You have enemies?

Did you know that I am the most- sued person in the history of the world? It’s in the Guinness Book, you could look it up. Prominent law schools devote entire semesters to my malfeasances, regulatory statutes bear my name- not the legacy I had in mind when I started out, but a legacy nonetheless. They pass some beautiful ROSEATE SPOONBILLS wading throug shallow pond-
We look back at our lives and we try to tally up the things we are proud of against the regrets-- do you have regrets, Mr. Harris?
(nods) More than a few.

At the moment, my greatest regret, other than having spawned the careers of thousands of tort lawyers, is having put an evil into the world that may become permanent- an evil that must be eliminated before it spirals out of control.
Your dinosaurs.
(smiles) Yes. My dinosaurs. How much do you know about them?
(shrugs) Most of them have been wiped out. A couple species have been making a nuisance of themselves-
Whenever a new organism, especially a predator with no natural enemies, is introduced into an ecosystem, the result is disastrous.
Pest control isn’t in my line-

I’m not proposing you run about with a butterfly net, Mr. Harris. The most effective weapon against any species is its own behavior- particularly its reproductive behavior. Take a population of any wild animal and introduce a number of highly aggressive but reproductively-neutered individuals within it- a ‘Judas strain’, so to speak-
Cuts down on the birth rate.
Who better to locate our errant creatures than their almost identical kin-
Why not give them diseases, too?
Viruses mutate faster than lawsuits, I'm afraid. Too much risk they'd begin to affect other species. But a large influx of young, aggressive, sterile but sexually attractive females-
Sounds like a college boy’s dream-
And the only solution, I believe, to our present crisis.  15.
Sounds good to me.

But not to the United Nations. They‘ve laughed off my proposals, outlawed not only the creation of any new dinosaurs, sterile or not, but also prohibited the world-wide mining, sale or possession of amber-
No little mosquitoes trapped in tree sap-
-means no basic genetic material to work with.
But even if you had these genes, you couldn‘t-

Among the people on the board of this aviary, funded through a trust I set up before my legal difficulties began, are some of the finest genetic scientists in the world. People who would be happy to risk implementing my plan- if a source of the vital DNA could be
located.
Something tells me you've found one.
I didn't find it, I left it behind. A former employee of mine, a Mr. Nedry-
We see NEDRY opening a safety vault disguised as an AEROS CAN and sticking pilfered tubes of dinosaur embryo into i 2  e

-at the behest of one of m, more unscrupulous competitors, conspired to steal a large quantity of genetic material, enough to engender at least forty species, from our laboratory at the Park. It was his misfortune, however-
Nedry’s vehicle slides out of control in the torrential downpour, leaving the road and coming to rest, stuck in t muck-
-to attempt this clandestine transaction during a- a period a severe technical malfunction at the facility.
Nedry faces off with a large, curious Chlamydosaurus Sput (‘spitting frilled lizard’ or ‘Spitter’). Its FRILLS pop and it HAWKS a throatful of nasty black stuff into Nedry’ face-
We were forced to abandon the island before his exact fate- Nedry runs back into his vehicle, but the SPITTER leaps i after him. Thrashing, BLOOD-
-or that of the material he had stolen could be determined. We PAN to the abandoned aerosol can, swept away by a rivu of rainwater and quickly covered with muck-
SONGBIRDS flit about in the branches all around them as t approach the rustic-built SNACK BAR-
But the people who took over the island-  ‘e

Grendel International. If they had found it they wouldn’t be constantly pressuring me to reveal its whereabouts. I have good reason to believe they might be the people who engaged Nedry in his betrayal.
Why would they want dinosaur genes?
I shudder to think. Hammond looks over the menu hanging above the snack bar counter-—
Major Overton tells me you're an expert in covert operations.
I was trained as a Navy Seal. I've been involved in- missions, in and out of uniform.
We know the sector Nedry was in when he disappeared. The stolen material seems to have been hidden in an aerosol can of some sort-
Deodorant.
Given the state of Nedry’s personal hygiene, I doubt it. We can provide you with a map-
There aren't any dinosaurs left on the island?
Grendel International claim to have- restored equilibrium. They maintain a small security force there to discourage trespassers-
So I go there and I steal this- 17.  e
Reclaim-
I bring this can of DNA back to you.
Captain Overton will be your contact. Hammond scribbles a number on a snack bar order pad, flas it to Nick, all the time wary of the approaching nurse. W see lots of zeros-
You will be amply rewarded for your risk, of course, with a generous bonus if you succeed. So? Nick considers, nods, resigned-
I’ve done worse for less.
(beaming) Excellent! Now- would you care for a sundae?
We start with an AERIAL SHOT of Isla Nublar in the distan across the water, then TILT DOWN to see a small local FIS BOAT in the FG-
Overton is there, checking a GPS instrument, as the boat' owner, RAMIREZ, deals with a NET thrown over the side fac the island-

This is the legal limit. There’s a couple patrol boats we'll hear from if we drift any closer. We PAN to see Nick, sitting on the deck beside the cabin (which blocks him from view from the island) and pulling the last of his black SCUBA GEAR-  e 19.
Give me ten minutes and then pull cut. You sure about this pilot?

They're used to seeing his plane around the coast. Eco-tours. Nick nods and pushes a camouflaged RAFT full of supplies overboard, clipping a nylon line attached to it to the ba of his belt. Ramirez comes over to watch as Nick lowers h mask and sits backwards en the gunwale-
Buena suerte, Senor. Nick nods, falls backward into the water and disappears. They watch the raft begin to pull away. Ramirez crosses himself-
Que Dios le proteja.

The BEACH looks inviting- gentle waves, strip of white sa a fringe of palm trees, little CRABS scuttling among the fallen coconuts. Suddenly Nick sits up in the surf, quick pulling off his flippers and mask and hustling across the sand to the shelter of the palms, dragging the supply raf behind him-

Very precise, very Mission Impossible, Nick strips off th wet suit, opens the raft supply compartment. Boots on, backpack, GPS UNIT and LAMINATED MAP on a lanyard over hi neck, then the weapons- automatic combat SHOTGUN, small P RIFLE with silencer, .50-caliber PISTOL in one holster an cell phone in the other- Nick crouches, sticks a HOMING DEVICE, as yet unarmed, in the sand at the edge of the tree-line. He trots off into jungle-

Nick moves quickly down an extremely overgrown PATHWAY, passing oddly-canted LAMP POSTS and torn, rusted sections metal FENCING.  20. This used to be the tourist track through the park. He st abruptly, listens- the usual Tarzan-movie JUNGLE SOUNDS, nothing you couldn’t hear on vacation. He checks his GPS, then trots away. We HOLD, then TILT UP the nearby LAMP POST to see a SURVEILLANCE CAMERA mounted near the top, swivelling to follow Nick's movement-

We shoot from GROUND LEVEL as Nick approaches from some distance, vaulting over a HOLE at the base of a gnarly-ro tree. We HOLD on the hole for a moment. A large, black, four- fingered REPTILE HAND emerges, CLAWS gripping the earth!

Nick is off the pathway now, moving through thick jungle he reaches a small CLEARING. He checks his map and GPS. H sees something, climbs a slight rise, pushes away some ta weeds. An abandoned, rusted-out 4-wheel-drive VEHICLE. Ni yanks a torn flap of canvas away to reveal- Nedry’s SKELETON! Bony fingers still clutching the steeri wheel. A SMALL LIZARD scuttles out through one of the eye sockets in the SKULL-

(regarding skeleton) Looks like you've dropped a few pounds. He rapidly searches the interior of the vehicle- seats, floor, glove compartment- nothing but a FLASHLIGHT and a of old CANDY WRAPPERS. He steps away, surveying the groun around him-

The backpack thumps to the ground. Nick upzips it and pul out pieces of a disassembled METAL DETECTOR. An ANIMAL SCREAM from back in the trees- Nick listens. Quiet again. He glances at his watch, begins to assemble the metal detector-
We see the metal detector disc sweeping over the ground-

Nick, T-shirt soaked through with sweat, has set up a GRI with wooden stakes and string. He is working a section several yards down from the vehicle, at the edge of a sha little STREAM. He pauses, wipes sweat off his forehead. O a whim he reaches the detector arm over the string and pa the disc over a little mud-bar in the center of the strea The machine CRACKLES. Nick drops the detector and jumps into the stream, diggin furiously at the mud-bar with his hands. He stops, feelin something, then pulls up- -a muck-covered BARBASOL CAN! Nick kneels, washes the can off in the stream, then pulls his cell phone and punches a number-
Yo. Objective secured. Proceed with extraction. I‘ll fire up the homer. He pulls a REMOTE CONTROL from his vest, pushes in a red button-
A BLINKING RED LIGHT flicks on, the device BEEPING softly

Nick moves quickly but cautiously through thick jungle, passing by a few of the big ROOT-HOLES. He slows, frownin listening- A RUSTLE behind him. A SNAP to the side. He starts up again, very slowly. Again the RUSTLE in the brush around him. Him brings the shotgun up, crouching-

!Bajelo! Nick freezes, turns his head-  22. 4 @ Out of the trees all arounij him appear a squad of six SECURITY RANGERS in camo uniforms, armed with short-barre AUTOMATIC RIFLES. The JEFE waves his rifle at Nick-
Deje caer las armas y pdéngase al suelo.
He wants you to drop your weapons and lie on the ground.
No tenga miedo, nomads queremos la lata.
Don’t be afraid. We only want the can. Your escopeta, por favor, put it on the ground.
Nick takes a deep breath, calculating, looks around at th men surrounding him. He sees something- ‘e
Is very good we find you before the dinosaurs do.
We shoot from behind the Jefe and Segundo toward Nick-
I was told there aren’t any left on the island.
(smiles) Oh, there’s a few-
Like the one standing behind you?
e@ We shoot the Segundo in profile as he LAUGHS- ww  e © 23.
That won't work my friend. The ones left here only come out in the night- CHOMP! A RAPTCR’s head lunges into the shot, jaws clampin on Segundo's neck and shoulder! He SCREAMS-—

Another RAPTOR pops up from the hole next to the Jefe. Th Rangers start to FIRE their weapons, as ANOTHER and ANOTH and ANOTHER jet-black, ruby-eyed EXCAVARAPTORS (‘digging killers’ or just DIGGERS) pop up from the holes- the men been standing in the middle of a colony of them! (These creatures are bow-legged, with huge, mole-like DIG CLAWS at the ends of their powerful forelimbs.) Bap-bap-bap-bap-bap-bap-bap! The Rangers have their rifle on spray and pray as they panic and scatter, the Jefe pin under one of the beasts’ powerful legs! Nick darts past the Segundo as the DIGGER lifts the man o his feet and shakes him. AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE rips into the trees around Nick as he dodges through the thick undergro a pair of the monsters pursuing him-

Nick zigzags between tree trunks, hurdles roots and falle logs while the bigger DIGGERS crash straight through, slo by the foliage. We hear SCREAMS and GUNFIRE from behind, growing more distant. Nick gets hung up on a prickler vin for a moment, the lead DIGGER gaining- Nick twists and BLAM! BLAM! blasts the creature in the fa and neck as it rushes in for the kill! The digger staggers, falls to one knee as Nick tears free sprints away. We HOLD as the second raptor reaches its wounded comrade, pauses, ROARS and then continues the cha

Nick staggers, bleeding from the pricker vine, into an overgrown CLEARING. He leans his back against the grill o an abandoned SERVICE VEHICLE, faded ‘Jurassic Park’ logo its side. He catches his breath, listening, quickly reloading his shotgun—  ‘e ©@ 24. A pointy little lizard-face pops up behind him, looking o through the shattered windshield of the vehicle. COMPSOGNATHUS. It is joined by ANOTHER, and ANOTHER and SEVERAL MORE. Cc SQUEAKS. Nick stiffens, then whirls- BLAM! he FIRES just as a dozen of the little carnivores stream out of the window at him, the ones that aren’t blo back into the vehicle by the blast leaping onto his face, shoulders, chest, arms, SQUEAKING excitedly! Nick spins, swatting and snatching, compys flying off him, then sprin for the nearby BUILDING. We HOLD on his abandoned SHOTGUN lying on the ground-

We shoot through a half-broken WINDOW as Nick sprints tow us, a dozen COMPYS in pursuit. He picks up speed, dives, folding his arms over his head- CRASH! Shards of glass go flying as he dives through the window, does a forward rol twists and comes up on one knee pulling his PISTOL from h holster in one motion- POP! POP! POP! POP! He picks off the compys one by one as they jump onto the windowsill! The rest of them seem to take the hint. Nick lowers his b on the window opening, looks around- We are in a dusty STAFF BARRACKS- a half-dozen BUNK BEDS, frames draped with COBWEBS along the walls, footlockers, old boombox, a coffeemaker in one corner by a row of stan lockers. Simple but not spartan. A POSTER of a TYRRANOSAURUS is starting to curl on the wa Someone has drawn a knife and a fork in its front claws, written in a cartoon balloon above its head- “Pass the tourists, please.” Nick pulls the laminated map off his neck, studies it-
(reading) Staff Quarters One, Two and Three--- utility tunnel-
We FOLLOW Nick's FINGER over the detailed diagram of the Park, DOTTED LINES indicating a utility tunnel that leads from the staff barracks to a power station near the south fence-
-leads to the power station-

-which is only two hundred yards from the beach. Nick looks around, steps over to a HATCH in one corner of room. He bends, grabs the handle, pistol ready in his oth hand, then yanks the hatch cover open! Nothing jumps out at him. Nick looks down into the BLACKNESS. He un-velcros a small but powerful FLASHLIGHT from his belt, shines it down the hatch-
We see a rusted metal LADDER leading down, a cement floor

Nick considers the tunnel, looks back to the window- Three compys stand ready on the windowsill, watching- Nick whips his pistol around but they jump away before he fire- He looks back into the dark tunnel below-

No way, José. He looks around, sees-- A CEILING HATCH over one of the bunk beds. Nick crosses, makes a face as he swipes away thick sheets COBWEB, climbs onto the top bunk, reaches up. The EYEHOOK and LATCH have rusted stuck together, they won't budge. N takes the butt of his pistol, gives it a hard rap- The hatch falls open and the top half of a half-eaten DEA MAN drops through!  ®

Nick SHOUTS in surprise, leaping backwards off the bed an sprawling onto the flcor, whipping his pistol up ready to shoot- The BODY is a Security Fanger who has been gnawed on pret bad, maybe a week old. Nick lowers his pistol, breathes deeply, trying to get hi heartbeat under control- WHAM! The DIGGER crashes through the front door and tumbl across the room, sliding on the floor and knocking the coffeemaker and standing lockers down on top of itself! Nick is trapped in the corner. The digger scrambles to it feet, ROARS, lunges- Nick pulls the bunk bed down over himself as a shield, crouching- THOONK! the raptor’s leg goes right through the deteriora mattress and springs, claws just missing Nick‘s throat. H scrambles out as the beast writhes to free itself, makes to the tunnel hatch and starts down the ladder, grabbing handle on the underside of the cover-

CRACK! The rusted metal rungs give way, snapping, Nick falling but able to yank the hatch cover- THUNK! THUMP! Nick hits the tunnel floor and the hatch cover falls shut, throwing us into BLACKNESS. CRANG! Raptor CLAWS punch through the hatch cover, then y away, tearing away the thin metal! Three stripes *f DAYLI appear to illuminate Nick below, getting to his feet. CRA the raptor tears at the hatch cover again. Nick flicks th flashlight back on, trots into the dark, high-ceilinged tunnel ahead-
We see through the palms to a small PONTOON PLANE approac over the sea-
A jerry-rigged HOMING SCREEN clipped to the control panel a BLINKING RED LIGHT lined up with the central cross hair  ‘e 27.
The pilot, a hippie-looking character in a Deadhead shirt named DARWIN, scans the beach-
You're sposed to be here, dude.

We watch as the plane slows and comes in for a water land TRACKING to meet it as it taxis up to the surfline. Darwin cuts the engine, hops out and into the water, wrestling the little plane around so it is pointing out t sea, MUTTERING all the while-

This gig is gnarly enough without being late, man. Security guards, spy gear, probly some kind of psychosauruses still running around the island- He runs a line from a U-bolt under the tail assembly to a thick ROOT sticking up from a half-buried DRIFTWOOD STUMP glancing at his watch-
I give you ten minutes and then I'm history.
Nick is trotting along the utility tunnel, pipes and wire overhead. So far, so good. He stops at a FORK in the tunnel, shines the light on his map-

There's no fork on the damn map- HRRRRRRRRRONK! The ROAR of the digger ECHOES down the tun behind him. No time for eenie meenie minie moe. Nick runs xright- CRUNCH! CRUNCH! CRUNCH! Something underfoot- Nick swings the light down- EGGSHELLS. Big ones. Dozens of them, all over the floor-
